Sentencas: The optimum operating temperature of micro solid oxide fuel cells (mu-SOFCs) is < 600 degrees C, which normally results in an undesirably high internal resistance.
Titulo: Highly active nanoscale Ni - Yttria stabilized zirconia anodes for micro-solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: While the resistance of the electrolyte (most commonly yttria stabilized zirconia, YSZ) can be lowered significantly simply by decreasing its thickness, minimization of the electrode resistance (thus maintaining rapid reaction kinetics) is not as straightforward.
Titulo: Highly active nanoscale Ni - Yttria stabilized zirconia anodes for micro-solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: In this work, an ethylene glycol based polymeric precursor solution, which promotes the intimate mixing of the Ni, Y and Zr components prior to their crystallization as oxides, was spin-coated onto a YSZ disc, generating a nanocomposite NiO-YSZ thin film.
Titulo: Highly active nanoscale Ni - Yttria stabilized zirconia anodes for micro-solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The in-situ reduction of NiO phase within the dense NiO-YSZ film to Ni, in combination with the nanoscale size of the Ni and YSZ particles (ca.
Titulo: Highly active nanoscale Ni - Yttria stabilized zirconia anodes for micro-solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: 25 nm), resulted in a nanoporous, Ni-YSZ anode morphology (thickness < 1 mu m) with a homogeneous distribution of Ni and YSZ and a very high triple phase boundary length.
Titulo: Highly active nanoscale Ni - Yttria stabilized zirconia anodes for micro-solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Very small electrode polarization resistances of 0.65 Omega cm(2) per electrode were obtained at 550 degrees C in humidified H-2, the lowest values yet reported for SOFCs at this temperature.
Titulo: Highly active nanoscale Ni - Yttria stabilized zirconia anodes for micro-solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: These highly active anodes are therefore very promising for use in next generation mu-SOFCs.
Titulo: Highly active nanoscale Ni - Yttria stabilized zirconia anodes for micro-solid oxide fuel cell applications
